intro: Gerardia decemloba, commonly known as the ten-lobed gerardia, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow disk flowers surrounded by pale green to white ray florets. It typically grows in sandy or well-drained soils in open, sunny habitats. Gerardia decemloba is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand salty air and wind.
